ABC 2 Personal and Possessive Pronoun Sentences - WS PA (Set 1 and 2)

Students recieved a worksheet with 8 sentences in ASL gloss already. Each  
sentence used family signs where students had to eaxplain how people were  
related to each other using singular and possessive pronouns.

They practiced their sentences in table groups, then they found a partner who  
had an opposite paper to them. They signed their sentences to a partner and  
wrote in English what their partner signed to them.

They wre given class time on 1-10 to complete. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6528650126

Students practiced the formatting for their expressive semester final, as  
this is a new type of test they have not experiences before. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6523150893
Students create some team norms for Task One. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6526064855

Students learned how to sing information about various languages. They then  
created 5 sentences following the prompts below:

1. Family member, SPEAKS, language

2. Family member, KNOW, language

3. Family member, LEARN, language, amount remembers (MOST, SOME, LITTLE BIT,  
ALL)

4. Family member, STUDY, language, # years

5. Family members, TAKE-UP, language, # years

After they created their sentences, they found a partner and signed them to  
them. They wrote in English what their partner signed to them. They had class  
time on 11/12 to complete this activity.  - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6528453269
AP Task One Agreement Forms Turned In
Students and guardians sign and turn in their AP Task One Agreement forms. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6533879172
Dihybrid Crosses & Rule of Multiplication Practice
Colleges and Languages Activity - Mad Lib Style - WS PA

Students learned how to sign different levels of schooling (elementary,  
junior high, high school and college).

They were then given a worksheet with some phrases writeen in ASL gloss. Each  
phrase had some blank lines in it that students had to fill in (like you do  
in a Mad Libs game).

They then signed their phrases to a partner and wrote what their partner  
signed to them in English.

They were given class time on 1/17 to complete. A few students completed  
first thing in class on 1/18 as they ran out of time to finish the class  
prior. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6537039783

Students watched 2 short conversation videos that were posted on Schoology.  
They recieved a worksheet with questions they had to answer by watching the  
videos and understanding what the signer's in the video were signing. This  
helps students practice their receptive skills.

They were given time in class on 11-18 to complete.

Once they completed this activity, they were supposed to watch the first  
vocab video in the Unit 2 folder to preview the last vocabualry for the unit  
that we will be learning tomorrow. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6537573889
Students complete a one-pager showing their research so far. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6536941204

Students learned how to identify people by their actions on 1/19. They were  
then given a worksheet with a photo of a classroom with rows of students on  
it. Each student was doing something different in the picture. For practice,  
the teacher identified a student by their action and gave that student a  
name. Students wrote the name next to the correct person on the worksheet.

On 1/23, students used the back of their worksheet (that had 2 pictures of  
the same classroom). On the top picture they named each student. They then  
met with a partner and identified 3 people (one from each row) by their  
action, then they told their partner that person's name (Example: SEE WOMAN  
WRITING? SHE NAME #BECKY). Their partner wrote the name next to the correct  
person in the 2nd photo (the blank one).

The third part of the activity was to then ASK your partner about 3 people in  
the picture by indentifying them by their action and asking what their name  
is (Example: SEE WOMAN WRITING? SHE NAME WHAT?). They should have chosen 3  
people, one from each row.

In the end, they should have 2 people in each row with a name next to them.  
They had class time on 1/23 to complete this activity. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6547346168
Classroom - School and Language Background - WS PA

Students were given a copy of the new classroom worksheet. They had to pick  
5 of the students on the worksheet and give the following information about  
them:

Name

School level (elementary, junior high, middle school, high school, college,  
or university)

LEARN, KNOW, STUDY, TAKE, language (Japanese, Spanish, English, ASL, German,  
French) 

# of years

Remember (most, some, little bit, all, none)

 

They then met with a patner and identified the person in the class by their  
actions, then shared the above information about them. Their partner wrote  
what was signed to them in English on the bottom worksheet.

Students had the entire class period on 1/24 to complete. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6550303846

Students can earn extended learning points each semester by reading a book  
about Deaf culture, ASL, etc. Books are 35 points each (limit 2 per  
semester).

Students must get their book approved by the teacher. Once the book is  
apporved, the teacher will give students a form to fill out. To earn credit  
for the book, students must fill out the form. They need to submit photos  
here as well as physically turn the form in to the teacher.

Students who are interested in college credit MUST READ ONE BOOK sometime in  
the school year.  - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6438751953

Students can attend Deaf Events to earn extended learning points during a  
semester. Deaf Events may be in person or virtual.

To prove they have attended, students need to upload a picture here of them  
at the event. Students need to be in the picture, and the background needs to  
be obvious that they are at the event. No face selfies. 

In person - find a sign or the stage or something to be the background of  
your picture.

Virtual - take a selfie of you with the screen of your computer that has the  
deaf event on it at the time of the event.

Students wishing to earn college credit need to attend ONE deaf event  
sometime in the school year.

Please note - I have no control when Deaf events happen. Last year we had 9  
in first semester and 1 in second semester. Sometimes we only have 3 or 4 a  
year. It varies wildly. SO - take advantage of them when they come around!! - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6438642276

Students can collect extended learning points by watching movies outside of  
class time. The movies must come from the list posted on Schoology in the  
Extended Learning folder. (This way students are not repeating movies each  
year).

When you watch a movie, post the name of the movie here. I will respond with  
a question about the movie. You then anser the questions.

Students can recieve points for 2 movies per semester. Each movie is 25  
points. 

Students who are interested in college credits can add these movies to their  
list of movies, books, and events that the college requires to earn credit  
from them. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6438735113

Students who earned extended learning points by watching movies, going to  
Deaf events or reading books about Deaf culture, ASL or Deaf people will see  
their points totalled here.

THIS IS OPTIONAL. IT IS NOT REQUIRED!

Students can collect up to 100 points. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6566547834
